name: C Programming Basics
description: Fundamental C programming concepts and syntax

questions.question: What is a pointer in C?
questions.answer: A variable that stores the memory address of another variable

questions.question: What is the difference between malloc() and calloc()?
questions.answer: malloc() allocates uninitialized memory, calloc() allocates and initializes memory to zero

questions.question: What is a struct in C?
questions.answer: A user-defined data type that groups related variables of different types under one name

questions.question: What is the difference between '++i' and 'i++'?
questions.answer: ++i increments before use (prefix), i++ increments after use (postfix)

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword?
questions.answer: Preserves variable value between function calls, or limits variable/function scope to current file

questions.question: What is the difference between pass by value and pass by reference?
questions.answer: Pass by value copies the value, pass by reference passes the memory address (using pointers in C)

questions.question: What is a segmentation fault?
questions.answer: Error when program tries to access memory it doesn't have permission to access

questions.question: What is the purpose of header files (.h)?
questions.answer: Contain function declarations and macro definitions to be shared across multiple source files
